Match_Report: Sri Lanka 160 for 4 (Sangakkara 55*, Dilshan 53) beat Australia 159 for 9 (Johnson 28*, Mendis 3-20, Malinga 3-36) by six wickets Scorecard and ball-by-ball details Kumar Sangakkara cracked a superb 55 Getty Images Sri Lanka eliminated Australia from the ICC World Twenty20 with a six-wicket victory at Trent Bridge. Kumar Sangakkara played a captain's innings to lead them across the line, with an over to spare, as they chased 160 after Tillakaratne Dilshan sparked the pursuit with an innovative 53 off 32 balls. Australia were set back by a magnificent display from Ajantha Mendis, who bamboozled with his variations, and although the match went to the final over Sri Lanka always held the edge to book their Super Eights berth. Australia's stay in this tournament - the international title they don't hold - lasted three days and now they face two extra weeks in Leicester to prepare for the Ashes series. Make no mistake, they desperately wanted to win this event, and further stock their trophy cabinet, but were short on their skills for the second game running against a highly impressive Sri Lanka outfit.

Commentary_Highlights: Onions to Watson, OUT got him first ball! Cut back sharply on Watson who was a little late on this good, quick and straight delivery and that's out! Onions to Hussey, OUT he's bowled him! He's bowled him! Hussey has left a straight one and his off stump is pegged back! What a disastrous start for Australia Onions to Ponting, OUT got him! He's out! A quick bouncer, Ponting went for a hook and got a thin edge through to Prior. Onions has bowled so, so well this morning Anderson to North, 1 leg bye swinging down leg this time, North gets pad on it and gets a leg-bye Anderson to Clarke, OUT oh he's got him! A huge inswinger here, curves late and strikes Clarke on middle and leg, Rudi Koertzen lifts the finger Anderson to North, OUT wonderful catch! Prior makes a super take diving to his left across first slip. Fullish ball swinging away from North, who got a thick edge to one that he might have left alone Anderson to Johnson, OUT oh he's gone too! Swings back in to Johnson, who is in two minds whether to leave it - he does leave it - and it hits him above the knee-roll Broad to Manou, 1 leg bye an lbw appeal this time but that one is swinging down leg Anderson to Manou, OUT wow! What a delivery! Anderson comes a touch wider and gets the ball to straighten and it comprehensively smashes Manou's off stump, that is almost the perfect ball. Anderson to Siddle, OUT fantastic delivery, swinging in, then straightening a touch on the right-hander who tries to work it through midwicket but gets a thick outside edge for Anderson's five Onions to Hauritz, 1 wide oh dear. Miles wide of the off stump - Onions saw Hauritz move Onions to Hilfenhaus, OUT got him! Another slapping drive finds Swann in the gully, and that's the final wicket for Onions who finishes with four wickets So Australia end on 263. Certainly an underpar total, but England's openers will need to be alert: Hilfenhaus and Co. swing it too. Anderson leads off his troops after finishing with five wickets. Righto, so join Brydon in about ten minutes for the 6.25pm - stumps So, that's it for the second day's play - an enthralling day it was. Don't forget to check out the video highlights (plenty to watch tonight) along with the bulletin if you've missed any of the play. And most importantly of all, mos 10.45am The umpires are out in the middle and having a look. It's dark and not ideal conditions, though it's not actually raining. More of a drizzle, and it doesn't really know whether to stop or whether to give it absolutely everything. Frustratin 11.00am No chance of any play before lunch, we reckon. It's seriously moist and damp out there. There'll be another pitch inspection at midday, and we'll keep you up to speed then. 12.00pm Right, pitch inspection is currently underway, but the two umpires don't look too enthusiastic and it's drizzling persistently. Meanwhile, doesn't Aleem Dar have a stupendous mullet atop his nugget? It looks like it's made out of wax. Outst Perusing what cricket books are coming up for sale. Always interesting to see who's publishing what. Don't forget out reviews section in the Magazine. Siddle to Bell, 5 wide oh dear, that's a shame for Siddle. A loose leg-side stray - just didn't come out right and flew miles wide of both batsman and keeper Hilfenhaus to Strauss, OUT Gone! Hilfenhaus makes the breakthrough, Strauss goes at last. Short of a length outside off and he gets a thick top edge attempting to cut, straightforward take for Manou. Hilfenhaus to PD Collingwood, OUT Hilfenhaus gets another! Well bowled, a fullish outswinger and Collingwood drives, the thick edge is well taken by Ponting above his head at second slip Johnson to Prior, 2 byes the first real stray from Johnson, and the crowd love it. Wings it wide of the leg stump. Manou doesn't have a hope. What a winner Siddle to Flintoff, 1 leg bye a leg-bye is taken. Flintoff limps through - could have had two, but he's nowhere near fit enough Siddle to Prior, OUT oops, mistimes this one and that's the end of Prior. Short ball, pulled and comes off the bottom of the bat, lobbing up to mid-on where the 12th man Phil Hughes takes the catch Hauritz to Flintoff, SIX runs oooh, Flintoff uses the feet here and lofts Hauritz clean over long-on, lovely shot, after some third-umpire assistance that is ruled a six having hit the boundary on the full Hauritz to Flintoff, OUT well, well. That's a very odd dismissal, it spins out of the rough and Flintoff plays no shot, but doesn't get his gloves out of the way, and the catch is taken at first slip Johnson to Swann, 1 wide short ball, not surprising with the short leg in place, but it's just a bit too far over the head Johnson to Swann, (no ball) wayhay! A no-ball bouncer, Swann sways out of the way Incidentally, there are 10,000 tickets available for tomorrow's fifth and final day. ?25 for adults, ?10 for under-16s. An absolute steal. Edgbaston.com is where to go. Match drawn Player of the match is Michael Clarke, AUS
Match_Report: Australia 263 (Watson 62, Anderson 5-80, Onions 4-58) and 375 for 5 (Watson 53, Hussey 64, Clarke 103*, North 96) drew with England 376 (Strauss 69, Bell 53, Flintoff 74, Broad 55, Hilfenhaus 4-109) Scorecard and ball-by-ball details Michael Clarke continued his fine form with another important second-innings century Getty Images After a rain-affected draw at Edgbaston, in which England's push for victory fell as flat as the fifth day pitch, the question now stands: who takes the momentum into Headingley? The temptation is to give the nod to England given their 1-0 series advantage and flashes of brilliance between the spells of drizzle in Birmingham. But, on closer inspection, the matter may not be so clear-cut. Australia will take tremendous confidence from their second-innings batting performance, in which three batsmen passed 50 and one, Michael Clarke, a stoic century in his 50th Test to limit England to just five wickets from 112 overs. Shane Watson's returns of 62 and 53 in his first Test as opener will prove particularly encouraging as will the final-day efforts of Michael Hussey (64) and Marcus North (96), both of whom were in need of a confidence boost. The Australians will also be buoyed at the possibility that Mitchell Johnson's nightmare might just have been confined to the month of July.

Commentary_Highlights: Behrendorff to S Dhawan, 1 leg bye appeal for lbw but not given. Full on off, and angling inwards. Tries to whip it off his legs, but the ball hits his back leg. Rolls away to square leg Jhye Richardson to Rahul, SIX runs full and wide outside off, and lifted into the stands! Width offered, and Rahul prods forward before confidently driving over the infield. Someone in the crowd makes a mess of the catch too Cummins to Rahul, SIX runs what a shot! Full on middle, right near his toes, and he nonchalantly flicks this over deep midwicket! All the work done by Rahul's bottom-hand. Proper whippage Coulter-Nile to S Dhawan, 1 leg bye offcutter, full outside leg stump. Dhawan tries to whip this behind square, but ball hits his front leg. No appeal for lbw, since the ball didn't pitch on the stumps. Ball rolls away to the leg side as the batsmen pinch a single Short to Pant, OUT gone, the pressure's told on Pant! Tosses this one up enticingly, a fair way outside off stump, and Pant goes for the big heave and loses his shape. Wasn't quite full enough for him to control perfectly, and it turns and skews up in the air for Jhye Richardson to take an outstanding catch, sprinting to his left from long-off and throwing himself horizontally at the ball Short to Dhoni, SIX runs another delivery along a similar trajectory, flighted and inviting Dhoni to go for another slog-sweep. Dhoni watches it better this time, and the ball soars way over the midwicket boundary Coulter-Nile to Kohli, SIX runs and yet, he can hit shots like this. Another slower ball, on a length and finishing on about off stump. Kohli just brings his wrists into play and flicks it all the way over the midwicket boundary Coulter-Nile to Kohli, SIX runs That's a Mahendra Singh Kohli shot alright! A couple of steps down the pitch to the off-stump length ball, and he brings his wrists into play once more to whip it high over the forward square leg boundary Jhye Richardson to Kohli, SIX runs bam. Doesn't get his attempted wide yorker wide enough or full enough, and Kohli takes a step across his stumps to get a little closer and swing through the line to clear the long-off boundary comfortably Cummins to Dhoni, OUT miscued, and Dhoni won't get his fifty. Cummins bowls a cross-seam ball, just short of a good length, on about off stump, and Dhoni, aiming towards long-on, slices it instead and long-off takes a simple catch walking a few steps forward off the rope Cummins to Kohli, SIX runs down the track, Cummins tries to bowl a slower ball out of his reach, well outside off, but doesn't quite succeed. He only allows Kohli to free his arms, and he does so gleefully to launch a crisp hit over the long-off boundary 8.46pm Hello, and welcome back to the second innings. Still a few minutes to go before the second innings gets underway. Make no mistake, this is barely an above-par total at the Chinnaswamy, but the wicket was double-paced for the first ten overs. Shankar to bowl Chahal to Short, 1 wide nice idea, but the execution goes slightly wrong. The quicker slider, angled away from Short and forcing him to reach out to drive. Just ends up angling it too wide Chahal to Maxwell, 1 wide looks to bowl that wide line he's bowled with success to Maxwell, but ends up bowling it too wide. Left alone Shankar to Maxwell, 1 wide slower ball gone wrong, ends up whanging it waaay outside off stump Shankar to Maxwell, SIX runs wham. He's bowled a lot of slower balls, and Maxwell was well prepared. Back of a length, on off stump, and he's back and across in a flash and has all the time in the world to swat this away over the midwicket boundary. That makes it 13 off this over, and 38 off Shankar's four. I guess India will take it, especially since he got the wicket of Short. Kaul to Maxwell, (no ball) SIX runs waist-high full-toss. We'll have to check for no-ball here. Yup, it is, but it doesn't matter to Maxwell, who opens up at the hips and simply wallops this over wide long-on. Sensational hitting, moves to 98 10.45pm And that is that from this T20I series. Come World Cup, you'd think Australia will have assembled a pretty damn formidable 15, regardless of their poor results in the format over the last couple of years. There's still an ODI series to go before that, and it begins on March 2 in Hyderabad. Be sure to join us for that. Until then, it's goodbye from Sreshth, Chandan and me. Good night! Australia won by 7 wickets (with 2 balls remaining) Player of the match is Glenn Maxwell, AUS
Match_Report: Australia 194 for 3 (Maxwell 113*, Short 40, Shankar 2-38) beat India 190 for 4 (Kohli 72*, Rahul 47, Dhoni 40) by seven wickets Glenn Maxwell was "disappointed" at not staying unbeaten during Australia's victory in the first T20I, and he made sure not to repeat that in the second. Coming in at 22 for two, Maxwell struck his third T20I century to chase down 191 in Bengaluru, and hand Australia their first bilateral T20I series win against the hosts. Chasing a target slightly above-par on a tricky pitch, Maxwell struck seven fours and nine sixes to top-score for Australia in back-to-back games. His unbeaten 55-ball 113 helped Australia cruise to victory with seven wickets in hand. That Maxwell had the liberty to play his shots was also down to the company that D'Arcy Short (40) gave him.

Commentary_Highlights: Siddle to Pietersen, OUT got him! Terrific ball that moved away just a touch from Pietersen, drawn forward into a drive, and it took a thin outside edge to a diving Haddin behind the stumps Johnson to PD Collingwood, 1 leg bye on his pads, Collingwood tucks it for a single to bring up England's 300. It's a start. A good start, but only a start. Clarke to PD Collingwood, OUT got him! Strauss is fuming with Collingwood here, as he skips down the pitch and miscues it - a horrible welly - straight to mid-on Johnson to Prior, OUT what a cracker! Johnson has got one to swing back in to the right-hander Prior and it's through the gate, takes off stump. Australia are well and truly back in this! Hilfenhaus to Flintoff, OUT gone! The old ball works out for Hilfenhaus. A great outswinger takes the edge of Flintoff's bat and Ponting and second slip snaffles the opportunity Hilfenhaus to Strauss, OUT GOT HIM! Strauss leaves one which bends back - a disastrous leave from the England captain and his off stump is pegged back. What a start for Australia! Siddle to Broad, (no ball) nicely stroked out to mid-off - full enough to do so Siddle to Swann, OUT edged to Ponting at second slip! Brilliant from Siddle, pitching it short and angling it up the hill and at chest height to Swann who angles it straight to slip Hilfenhaus to Broad, OUT bowled him! Three in fifteen minutes for Australia as Broad again attempts a loose drive outside off and drags it on Johnson to Anderson, OUT got him this time! Got big on him and square cut it low to gully who took a fine catch Anderson to Ponting, OUT big appeal, and what's happened here? It was a dual lbw/caught appeal and Ponting is out caught at first slip! Angled in, there must've been an inside edge onto the pad and after Koertzen checks if the ball carried, he g Onions to Katich, OUT this is up in the air at fine leg - what a catch! A stunner from Broad. On the pull, he top-edged it and Broad ran 10 or 12 yards to his right before diving, taking it low. Brilliant Anderson to North, 4 byes wide of the off stump and it shoots through a little low on Prior, though he really should've stopped that Onions to Hauritz, OUT got him! Short of a length outside off, Hauritz goes back and tries to force it off the back foot but can only edge to Collingwood who holds a safe catch at third slip So, yes, they're going to have another bat. No great surprise really. Here's Brydon until lunch. Innings Start Lots of oohs and aahs from the slips
Match_Report: England 425 and 311 for 6 dec (Prior 61, Collingwood 54) beat Australia 215 and 406 (Clarke 136, Haddin 80, Johnson 63, Flintoff 5-92, Swann 4-87) by 115 runs Scorecard and ball-by-ball details Andrew Flintoff strikes a pose after dismissing Brad Haddin on his way to a five-wicket haul on his final Test appearance at Lord's Getty Images In his final act at the home of cricket, Andrew Flintoff broke England's 75-year Lord's curse with his first five-wicket haul since the Ashes-clinching Oval Test of 2005. It was, unquestionably, a performance that will enhance his already mythical status within English cricket, but more pertinently for now, delivered England to a 1-0 series lead heading into Edgbaston. Victory was sealed 17 minutes before lunch when Graeme Swann, another major contributor on Monday, pegged back Mitchell Johnson's middle stump with the Australian total at 406. The wicket prompted scenes of jubilation not witnessed at Lord's in decades, and a collective furrowing of brows in the Australian dressing rooms as the series momentum shifted sharply in the hosts' favour. Flintoff, who bowled unchanged for ten overs from the Pavilion End to claim three of the five Australian wickets to fall on Monday, broke first from England's celebratory huddle to shake the hands of the vanquished Johnson and his batting partner, Ben Hilfenhaus.

Commentary_Highlights: Siddle to Pietersen, 1 bye oh dear - a big inswinger down the leg side and Haddin palms it to fine-leg Hilfenhaus to PD Collingwood, OUT got him - what a catch by Haddin diving to his right! Just outside the off stump, Collingwood edged it and Haddin moved a little late, but clung on with both hands Hauritz to Pietersen, OUT got him! A terrible shot from Pietersen, trying to sweep this from miles outside off without getting down into position, and he top edges it meekly straight into the hands of a delighted Katich at short-leg Siddle to Flintoff, OUT bowled him! An horrid, angled bat as he tries to drive but gets a thick inside edge which hammers into his stumps Siddle to Prior, OUT inswing back into the right-hander and he's bowled him! A fantastic delivery by Siddle - huge, late inswing and it forces its way through Prior's gate Johnson to Broad, OUT bowled him! Johnson gets one on target at last and bowls Broad off his pads and around his legs Hauritz to Anderson, OUT down the pitch and he tries to lift him over mid-on but he can't - an easy catch for Hussey who jumps back and swallows it Hilfenhaus to Swann, 1 leg bye worked off his pads for a single Hauritz to Panesar, OUT that's the end of the innings, Hauritz gets his third with a ball that drifts in and Panesar gets a thick edge to second slip Broad to Haddin, 1 wide short on off stump, Haddin thinks about hooking and then pulls the bat out of the way at the last moment Broad to Haddin, 1 wide another bouncer, it's well over Haddin's head and Billy Doctrove calls it a wide Flintoff to Haddin, 1 bye starts with a stiff shocker down the leg side. Prior does well to dive to his left Panesar to Haddin, SIX runs superb shot. Down the pitch and smashing it over the top. Damien Martyn couldn't have played it better Swann to North, 1 leg bye goes for a reverse sweep, rapped on the pads but outside the line. And hit on the glove. PD Collingwood to Haddin, OUT and finally, something for the England fans to cheer. Haddin goes over the top again, trying for a six out to midwicket and Bopara takes the catch. And with that comes the declaration. So Australia have played magnificently to build a lead of 239. North and Haddin were wonderful today. Now it's on England's top order to make the pitch look as placid as their Australian counterparts. Haddin Match drawn Player of the match is Ricky Ponting, AUS
Match_Report: England 435 (Pietersen 69, Collingwood 64, Prior 56) and 252 for 9 (Collingwood 74, Hilfenhaus 3-37) drew with Australia 674 for 6 dec (Ponting 150, Katich 122, North 125*, Haddin 121, Clarke 81) Scorecard and ball-by-ball details James Anderson and Monty Panesar steal a single to guide England to safety at Cardiff AFP James Anderson and Monty Panesar produced the most important innings of their lives as England's final pair survived 11.3 overs to pull off a thrilling escape at Cardiff. When Paul Collingwood fell for a monumental 245-ball 74 England still trailed by six, but once Australia had to bat again, valuable time was taken out of the game leaving Andrew Strauss and a packed Cardiff nervously clock-watching. The Australians threw everything into the final hour in an electric atmosphere with the crowd cheering the two unlikely batting heroes as though the Ashes had been won. A vital moment came when Anderson collected consecutive boundaries off Peter Siddle to finally erase the deficit.

Commentary_Highlights: Onions to Ponting, OUT a roar from the crowd as Ponting aims a loose swish at a short wide ball, one he could easily have left, and a thick edge is easily held by Solanki at Harmison to Hussey, OUT gone! Superb bowling from Harmison, full and swings in late to beat Hussey's drive and an excellent innings comes to an end Onions to Hauritz, OUT goes for a wild pull, but the ball was a too wide of off stump and he sends a high catch to point Check out Cricinfo's TwelfthMan England v Australia Fantasy Cricket which is absolutely free to play. Just log in or register to join the fun and you could win the Ultimate Cricket Lee to Denly, OUT finally! Australia make the breakthrough as Lee strikes in his comeback over, finding some late swing and crashes one through Denly who is caught on the cr Lee to Bell, OUT two in two, how the game changes! Full and more late swing, Bell plants his front leg across the stumps and is taken on the pad. The umpire says that will t Lee to Solanki, OUT well bowled! More reverse swing for Lee and Solanki's high back-lift does for him, he can't get down in time and the ball goes from pad into off stump Lee to Moore, OUT goes! A bouncer works this time and what a great spell from Lee. He bangs in it and Moore sizes up the pull, but the top-edge flies backward of square wher Lee to Morgan, OUT gone again! More brilliant fast, late, reverse swing from Lee and Morgan is trapped in front of leg my a tracer-bullet of a delivery. It speared in toward North to Davies, OUT tossed up delivery, hint of turn - Davies goes back looking to cut it away but ends up with a thick edge and the ball goes straight to Clarke at first s Johnson to Bresnan, OUT bowled him! And that's Johnson's first wicket of the game, he angled a short of a length delivery across Bresnan who hung his bat out at the ball, it Lee to Mahmood, OUT oh he's been bowled! Lee fires in a short ball, forcing Mahmood to duck in a hurry, Mahmood isn't quick enough and the ball thuds into his shoulder befor Clark to Rashid, OUT caught! Rashid's slashed several through and over the point region but this time he cuts it hard but straight to the fielder Innings Start Match State: Tea - Day 4
Match_Report: England Lions 352 (Moore 120, Rashid 66, Denly 66, Lee 6-76) and 162 for 4 (Morgan 28*, Johnson 2-48) drew with Australians 358 and 438 for 4 dec (North 191*, Clarke 80, Hussey 62) Scorecard How they were out Marcus North finished the match unbeaten on 191 Getty Images Marcus North led the Australians with 191 not out and they were also encouraged by the performances of Mitchell Johnson and Brett Lee as they completed a useful warm-up for Wednesday's first Test. After North sped the Australians to 438 for 4 at the lunch-time declaration in Worcester, the tourists were pleased to see Johnson remove both openers and Lee gain reverse-swing in the 33rd over before the match was called off almost an hour early. The end was signalled shortly after the umpire Jeff Evans collapsed on the side of the pitch with the England Lions 162 for 4. Johnson was more fluent as he built on a rusty performance in the first innings during a nine-over spell that set him up for Cardiff. He enters the Ashes as Australia's major weapon and the only thing missing is the sharp movement that turned him into a dominator during the series in South Africa.

Commentary_Highlights: 1.50 pm: It's a good Saturday to all you following this game between India and Australia at the Feroz Shah Kotla in New Delhi. It's a really busy day for all of us here but don't worry, we're not going to pile it on you guys. The toss is about 10 minutes away. Yuvraj to Watson, OUT sharp work by Dhoni! Yuvraj tosses it up outside off and draws Watson forward, he's beaten on the drive, the ball holds its line and Dhoni whips off the bails before the batsman can draw his backfoot back at the crease, the third umpi Jadeja to Ponting, OUT trapped in front! Jadeja fires it full and quick on middle, Ponting tries to clip it across the line but the ball hits the base of the pads (close to the boot) right in front of the stumps Raina to White, OUT it appears as if White's got a rough decision there. Raina bowls it flat again and White leaves a small gap between bat and pad, it almost sneaks right through before reaching Dhoni who juggles and appeals for the catch, umpire Saheba g Harbhajan to Voges, 1 wide another ball way down the leg side from Harbhajan Harbhajan to Voges, OUT Harbhajan Singh gets a wicket, Voges sashays down the track and slams the ball with the spin towards deep midwicket, Praveen hangs on to a good catch Jadeja to Henriques, OUT fires this one towards legstump, Henriques moves away from leg yet again, gets a bottom edge as he looks to slam that through the off, the ball bounces once before hitting legstump Johnson to Tendulkar, 1 wide poor delivery down the leg side and Sachin shoulders arms Johnson to Sehwag, OUT timber! The middle stump is flattened, Johnson lands it in a good length on middle and off, Sehwag is trapped at the crease, he tries to work it across the line but leaves a big gap between bat and pad, the ball sneaks right through a Hauritz to Gambhir, OUT What a ball! Gambhir was just flummoxed, Hauritz lands it on a good length on middle, the ball grips, turns and beats the gap between pad and bat and clips the off stump, Gambhir looked quite lost at the crease and barely attempted Bollinger to Dhoni, 1 bye starts with a ball well outside off, Dhoni  Siddle to Yuvraj, 1 wide down the leg side, Yuvraj looks to tickle it past the keeper but misses Siddle to Yuvraj, 1 bye full and wide, Yuvraj looks to steer it past the keeper but misses, the ball takes off after passing the wicket making it difficult for the keeper to catch Henriques to Yuvraj, SIX runs wow, sensational timing from Yuvraj, almost no power behind that flick which sends the ball sailing over the long-on boundary Voges to Yuvraj, SIX runs short ball, Yuvraj says thank you and bludgeons it over the long-on boundary Henriques to Yuvraj, OUT lbw! Henriques came round the wicket and angled a good length ball into the left-hander, Yuvraj stayed in his crease, missed it and got hit on the back pad, was that going down leg? Umpire Saheba didn't think so. Yuvraj's played a "On this wicket, I think everybody bowled well. I'm really happy. If there was no dew 220-230 could have been difficult to chase. The pitch was looking really ugly. All in all, it was a great team effort." India won by 6 wickets (with 10 balls remaining) Player of the match is Yuvraj Singh, INDIA
Match_Report: India 230 for 4 (Yuvraj 78, Dhoni 71*) beat Australia 229 for 5 (Hussey 81*, Ponting 59, Watson 41) by six wickets Scorecard and ball-by-ball details How they were out Yuvraj Singh's half-century boosted India during a tense period in their chase AFP Yuvraj Singh and MS Dhoni shared a serene 148-run stand to help India win a battle of attrition on a sluggish track at the Feroz Shah Kotla and take a 2-1 lead in the seven-ODI series. Australia would perhaps rue the fact that they settled for 229 when they batted after winning an important toss. "A total of 220 should be a good score on this pitch," Ponting had said and Australia's approach while batting reflected his mindset. Their bowlers did pick up three quick top-order wickets to leave India wobbling at 53 for 3 but Yuvraj and Dhoni batted with the knowledge that sufficient time spent at the crease would ensure a risk-free victory. The pitch was slow and not conducive to stroke making but it did not spin treacherously, despite the visibly dramatic wear and tear.

Commentary_Highlights: Toss: Australia won the toss and have chosen to bowl. Siddle to Tendulkar, OUT Siddle takes out SRT. Full in length, outside off, luring Tendulkar across but it straightens to take the edge. Full length delivery after the bouncer does the trick. Tendulkar played away from the body there, much like in the first game. What a lovely start from Siddle. Hilfenhaus to Sehwag, 1 wide high bouncer on the leg and middle line, climbs over Sehwag who ducks Johnson to Sehwag, OUT What a soft dismissal! It was a full length delivery around the off stump line, Sehwag went for the big airy drive but mistimed it completely and sends a dolly of a catch to mid-off. It was outside off and Sehwag ended up slicing his drive Johnson to Yuvraj, 1 wide again going down leg side, Yuvraj fails to connect with the flick and Paine gathers Hauritz to Yuvraj, SIX runs Yuvraj goes down town. He skipped down the track and lifted it cleanly over long-off. Interestingly. Ponting had just brought the long-off in for this ball and Yuvraj has taken up the challenge. Hilfenhaus to Yuvraj, OUT Done in by the slightly slower one. It was full, it was straight and Yuvraj couldn't keep his drive down. Hilfy swoops to pick up a sharp catch on his follow through. Australia tighten the screws. Hilfenhaus to Dhoni, 1 leg bye Ouch! It crashes against the helmet. Clatter. It was the bouncer, Dhoni just didn't pick it up and just yanked his head away. The ball hit the helmet on the back. He had just turned his face behind and the ball crashed against the bottom of the helmet. Had it gone few inches down, it would have go Voges to Gambhir, 1 wide spins down the leg side .. wide Johnson to Gambhir, 2 leg byes goes for the yorker, ends up as a low dipping full toss on the legs, rolls away to fine-leg. He was out to a similar ball in the first game Watson to Gambhir, 1 leg bye short of a good length delivery, on the middle and off stump line - Gambhir tries to work it away on the leg side but fails to make contact and the ball rolls away off the pad. Dhoni calls early and once again they scamper through for a well judged single Johnson to Raina, 2 wide wayward delivery down the leg side and Paine does well to make a diving half-stop Johnson to Dhoni, 1 wide from round the stumps but slips in a wide delivery outside off stump. Raina walks across to punch Dhoni's gloves Johnson to Dhoni, OUT Dhoni falls after a superbly paced knock. It was a full delivery on the off stump line, he tried to whip it across the line but edged it to right of Paine who takes a tumbling catch. Dhoni gets a standing ovation from the crowd. He started off ,dealing in singles, before he turned violent in the end Johnson to Raina, OUT Another sharp catch from Paine. Raina edged the intended lofted hit to long-on and the ball appeared to be flying over Paine who leaped to bring it back to earth. What a gem of a cameo from Raina, though. Bosh. Biff. Wham bham stuff from him. Praveen to Ponting, 1 wide goes for the slower one but slips down the leg side Sharma to Watson, OUT Ishant strikes first ball. It kicked up high from short of length, Watson was pressing forward before he tried go back and dab it to third man. However, he was done in by the extra bounce. At the last minute, he tried to adjust by taking out the bottom hand off the handle but only succeeded in guiding the bal Praveen to Ponting, OUT trapped right in front. PK has taken out the big wicket of the Australian captain and the crowd roar their approval. It was a length delivery that cut in from just outside off. Ponting was on the front foot, looking to drive on the up but is beaten by the inward movement. He was struck in line on the off a Yuvraj to Hussey, 1 leg bye on the leg stump line, slower through the air, Hussey is through with the flick a touch early and is struck on the pad Harbhajan to White, OUT White has been repeatedly trying to get down the track but has been unable to reach the pitch of the ball. And he has adjusted by jabbing it away,. But this time, he tries to go through with the shot and only succeeds in lobbing a dolly to Raina at straight ish midwicket. Harbhajan to Hussey, 1 wide on the leg stump line, goes for the sweep but misses Jadeja to Hussey, OUT He took out Ponting with a good delivery in the last game Harbhajan to Marsh, 1 leg bye on the pads, tries to sweep and collects a leg bye Harbhajan to Johnson, 1 wide down the leg side and Sahiba extends his arms Sharma to Hauritz, 1 wide banged in short and well outside off, cut and a miss .. That's it from us. good bye and good luck Player of the match is MS Dhoni, INDIA
Match_Report: India 354 for 7 (Dhoni 124, Gambhir 76, Raina 62) beat Australia 255 (Hussey 53, Jadeja 3-35) by 99 runs Scorecard and ball-by-ball details How they were out MS Dhoni: Unstoppable AFP First, he consolidated the innings with Gautam Gambhir. Then, in tandem with Suresh Raina, he ripped the bowling to shreds. MS Dhoni's superb 107-ball 124 was the foundation for India's highest-ever total against Australia, a mammoth 354 for 7, and once Praveen Kumar and Ishant Sharma winkled out Australia's top three for just 45, the match was effectively over. Michael Hussey's 53 provided a lone note of defiance as India romped home by 99 runs, to leave the series all square as the teams packed their bags and headed to Delhi. The match slipped out of Australia's grasp in the final 11 overs of the Indian innings.

Commentary_Highlights: Jadeja to Ponting, OUT Plumb in front. Ponting doesn't look happy. It landed on a length on the middle and leg, turned in past the defensive push and hit him on the back pad right in front of middle stump. Dead plumb. Fine innings comes to an end. Nehra to White, OUT White falls after taking the batting powerplay. It was the full delivery outside off, White tried to fetch it from there with a big slog but ended up slicing it high to extra cover where Raina waits patiently for the ball to dip into Harbhajan to Voges, OUT tossed up on the off stump line, spins in, Vogues goes for the slog sweep but gets more elevation than distance and is caught in the deep Sharma to Hussey, OUT Hussey falls after a wonderful knock. Hilditch must be watching closely. He dragged the ball from outside off and heaved it to deep midwicket Sharma to Lee, OUT full delivery, lee tries to squeeze it out to the on side, misses it and it deflects off the back pad on to the stumps Lee to Sehwag, 1 leg bye cuts in from the off stump line, rolls off the pad to the off side and Tendulkar calls him over for a single Siddle to Sehwag, 5 wide pushes it wide down the leg side and Tim Paine can't quite get behind it and the ball bursts through the gloves Watson to Tendulkar, OUT Ricky Ponting takes a neat catch at short extra cover. Tendulkar drove on the up to left of Ponting who flung himself to take a sharp catch. Two down and wobbling. Australia move into the driver's seat. Hopes to Kohli, 1 leg bye loud shout for lbw. It landed on a length on the off and cut in sharply and struck Kohli in front of the leg. The umpire reckoned it would have missed leg  Hauritz to Kohli, 1 leg bye flighted outside off stump, Kohli tries to work it to the on side and is struck just outside off stump Voges to Kohli, OUT Virat is once again caught at long-off. We have seen that quite often in the IPL and Champions League games as well. He charged down the track but was beaten in flight, tried to go though with the shot and skied it up. Watson ran in Johnson to Gambhir, OUT caught right in front by the low dipping full toss. It was dipping in front of leg and middle stump and Gambhir stumbled a bit while trying to get forward and flick it. He missed and was struck dead plumb. Johnson to Raina, OUT Done in by the slower one. Raina was completely fooled Johnson to Jadeja, 2 wide low full toss well down the leg side and Paine makes a tumbling half-stop Watson to Dhoni, OUT And Australia on the ascendancy here. Dhoni charged out for the big shot but mistimed it straight to mid-on. Lee throws the ball up in the air and Dhoni crashes his bat onto the ground. Joy and sorrow collide. Johnson to Jadeja, 1 wide slips down the leg side and it will be a wide Hauritz to Jadeja, OUT he survived a close shout couple of balls earlier but not now. It landed on a length on the middle and off line, Jadeja went for the sweep, missed and was struck in front. It would have hit the off stump. And then they were three. Watson to Harbhajan, 1 leg bye another slower one, Harbhajan is early in to the swing across the line and collects a leg bye Hauritz to Harbhajan, SIX runs Massive! He took couple of steps down the track and heaves the delivery from well outside off to wide long-on boundary. The crowd find their voice again and the ball is lost. New balls please. Siddle to Harbhajan, SIX runs What a stunner! It was the waist-high full toss, from round the stumps, and Harbhajan just swatted it away over fine-leg boundary Siddle to Harbhajan, OUT Clatter! The off stump has been pegged back. Siddle roars and the crowd applaud the departing Harbhajan. He opened up his stance and tried to swing the length delivery across the line but missed. Timber! Enter Ashish Nehra. what Both teams shake hands and they wait for the post-match ceremony. Hang on for a short while, we would bring you the breathless quotes from that. Hopefully, we would know why Brett Lee wasn't used in the end. Was he injured? He was there on the field, though. L Player of the match is Michael Hussey, AUS
Match_Report: Australia 292 for 8 (Ponting 74, Hussey 73, White 51, Paine 50, Ishant 3-50) beat India 288 for 8 (Gambhir 68, Harbhajan 49) by 4 runs Scorecard and ball-by-ball details How they were out Ricky Ponting top scored for Australia with a classy 74 Getty Images If the best way to spark interest in a seven-match ODI series is to stage a brilliantly tense opener, then Australia and India achieved their goal in Vadodara. Ricky Ponting and Michael Hussey set up what looked like being a comfortable Australian win until a lively, crowd-lifting partnership from Harbhajan Singh and Praveen Kumar threatened to snatch victory for India. In the end, nine were required from the final over and Peter Siddle held his nerve to confirm a four-run margin in Australia's favour. The key moment came when Harbhajan (49) was bowled from the second ball of the 50th, trying to launch a boundary off Siddle. Six from the last ball was too much for Ashish Nehra to produce.

Commentary_Highlights: Mohammad Asif to Katich, OUT caught! slashes at a ball short outside off, cut away in the air to Salman Butt at backward point who takes a good catch. A similar position to where Umar Akmal dropped Katich th Mohammad Asif to Ponting, OUT caught! forward to a fullish delivery outside off, Ponting is looking to drive through the off side, but the movement deceives him as he only manages an outside edge which is co Amir to Hussey, 1 bye left outside off, another credit to extras as Kamran Akmal fumbles the take and the batsmen take the bye Amir to Hussey, 1 bye good length delivery, shouldering arms, not taken cleanly by the keeper which gives away a bye Ajmal to Hussey, OUT coming round the wicket and fires it on a good length on the off, Hussey bends low to sweep, misses and is struck on the pads, Doctrove's given him, but Hussey has decided to call for t Amir to Hauritz, (no ball) steps out to leg, played down on the on side Abdur Rauf to Hauritz, OUT lbw! full length delivery, taken on the pad trying to flick the ball to the on side, the bowler's appeal for lbw is turned down, so the fielding side calls for a referral. Hawkeye That wicket brings about a declaration from the Australian captain. It's come a little bit earlier than one might have expected, despite the obvious attacking attitude from the batsmen since lunch. Shane Watson to bowl now. A slip, gully and short extra cover Watson to Salman Butt, OUT he's given him and Salman Butt has called for a review, Rudi Koertzen's finger went up slowly after it landed on a good length on leg stump and moved further towards the stumps, Bu Siddle to Mohammad Yousuf, OUT caught-behind, short of a length on leg stump, moves across, tries to work it fine and then appears to decide against it, the Australians think he got a touch as Haddin takes i Johnson to Umar Akmal, OUT caught! shortish delivery, the batsman tries to flay from the crease through the off side, he gets a thick outside edge which is collected cleanly by the Australian skipper at seco Hauritz to Misbah, SIX runs tossed up outside the off stump and Misbah picks it up and launches it over the midwicket fence for a six, wonderful shot on his first ball to Hauritz. Bollinger to Amir, OUT caught! back to a short of a length delivery, tries to fend the ball at chest height, gets a thick outside edge that flies directly into the hands of Marcus North at first slip Bollinger to Kamran, OUT caught behind! tries to drive a good length delivery from the crease with minimal footwork, gets a little outside edge which is collected gratefully by wicket-keeper Haddin Bollinger to Abdur Rauf, OUT caught! good length delivery, has the batsman proding forward from the crease, gets a thick outside edge which is collected by North at first slip Siddle to Mohammad Asif, OUT caught! back to a short of a length delivery, Asif tries to defend it at waist height, gets a thick outside edge high on the bat which carries directly to Watson at third slip wh Innings Start Faisal Iqbal is the new batsman
Match_Report: Australia 5 for 454 dec (Katich 98, Watson 93, Hussey 82, Ponting 57) and 8 for 225 dec (Watson 120*, Aamer 5-79) beat Pakistan 258 (Mishah 65*) and 251 (Yousuf 61, Hauritz 5-101) by 170 runs Scorecard and ball-by-ball details How they were out Nathan Hauritz achieved his maiden five-wicket haul Getty Images The Australians rounded out 2009 with their most clinical final day bowling performance of the year to seal a 170 run victory over Pakistan. Nathan Hauritz, placed on notice by Australia's selectors prior to the series, claimed his first career five-wicket haul as Pakistan crumbled from 3 for 170 overnight to be all out for 251 shortly after lunch on the final day. Hauritz's ability to exploit wearing pitches had been called into question of late, not least by Andrew Hilditch, and he proved himself worthy of the challenge on Wednesday. Unable to replicate the biting turn that accounted for Faisal Iqbal the previous day, Hauritz instead utilised flight and bounce to challenge Pakistan's lower and middle orders and was rewarded with four final-day scalps. Australia began the day in emphatic fashion with Mitchell Johnson removing Umar Akmal and Misbah-ul-Haq with consecutive deliveries in his first over.

Commentary_Highlights: Australia have won the toss and opted to bowl. Handscomb to not only debut but also keep wickets. Behrendorff to Rohit Sharma, OUT the short fine-leg shows great anticipation and takes a simple catch in the end!. Rohit goes for a premeditated scoop, it doesn't quite come onto the bat, he doesn't get all of it and ends up spooning it to short fine-leg, who was ready for it before the shot was even completed Zampa to Kohli, OUT down the track, gets to the pitch but flicks it aerially straight down long-on's throat. Zampa got a hint of drift which perhaps resulted in Kohli dragging the ball to the leg side when he may have preferred going straight over the bowler's head Zampa to Rahul, SIX runs down the wicket and Rahul goes through the line, over the bowler's head for a maximum. He got the length and it was also the straighter one Coulter-Nile to Rahul, OUT Rahul backs away to go through the off side but the bowler does well to follow him, cramping him for the room he was trying to make and he only gets it off the bottom of the bat to spoon a simple catch to mid-off Coulter-Nile to Karthik, OUT Coulter-Nile barges through the defences of Karthik. He dares to shimmy down the pitch, Coulter-Nile hits a hard length and gets it to move back in slightly. Karthik, having left his crease, misses it altogether and is bowled through the gate. Jhye Richardson to Yadav, 1 leg bye short and slanted in, Umesh plays around his front pad and misses the leg-side flick. Off the pad and the ball rolls to square leg Cummins to Yadav, 1 wide length, angled in, Umesh shuffles across, misses the leg glance and it's called wide Cummins to Yadav, OUT shuffles across and this was waiting to happen. Caught plumb in front to a straight, quick ball at 144 kmph and doesn't even bother to review it Jhye Richardson to Dhoni, 5 wide full and down the leg side, Dhoni can't get any bat on it but the angle beats even the diving keeper Coulter-Nile to Dhoni, 1 leg bye length on middle, Dhoni swings, misses again but gets a legbye to point Bumrah to Finch, OUT struck on the pad and given! The ball angled in had Finch's number all summer and Bumrah hasn't forgotten as that was full, nipping back in, striking Finch quite low and it's umpires call even as Finch reviews. Two in two for India and suddenly India's total isn't looking so bad Markande to Maxwell, SIX runs full outside off, enticing Maxwell to go big and Maxwell obliges with a massive hit over long-on Yadav to Short, 1 wide length, angled in down the leg side and called wide That's all from us, hoping everyone has their fingernails in tact, goodnight. Australia won by 3 wickets Player of the match is Nathan Coulter-Nile, AUS
Match_Report: Australia 127 for 7 (Maxwell 56, Short 37, Bumrah 3-16) beat India 126 for 7 (Rahul 50, Dhoni 29*, Coulter-Nile 3-26) by three wickets Two-paced pitches can do strange things. Long tails can do strange things. Those two ingredients combined in Visakhapatnam to produce an intriguing low-scoring thriller, and in the end it was Australia who shaded a tight contest between two imperfect teams. It came down to the last ball, with two runs needed, and Pat Cummins, who had just slapped the previous delivery, a wide full-toss, to the cover boundary, kept his head to complete the job. Umesh Yadav sent down a good ball, in the blockhole, and Cummins nudged it down the ground towards long-on, knowing the fielder was too deep to sprint in off the boundary and cut off the second run.

Commentary_Highlights: Benn to Katich, OUT caught! Katich goes on 99! He stretches forward, gets down on one knee to play the sweep and connects firmly, but he's hit it in the air, and Roach sees the ball swerving towards him at Deonarine to Clarke, OUT gone! Clarke can't control himself, tries to come out and take the ball on the full but miscues the aerial shot and picks out Gayle stationed at short midwicket, who steps to his r Bravo to Johnson, OUT short of a length delivery and Johnson hits in the air down the ground to long off and Benn takes a good catch. Johnson to Dowlin, OUT aims to drives and having to reach for it, struggles to keep it down and Hussey takes a neat catch in gully - the end of a very good innings McKay to Sarwan, (no ball) defends off the back foot to mid wicket Bollinger to Sarwan, OUT Sarwan falls in the second ball of the day, it was fuller outside the off stump and Sarwan goes for the big booming drive, gets the edge and the ball flies to Hussey at gully. Johnson to Deonarine, OUT hit in the air and Watson diving forward at short cover takes a good catch inches off the ground. It was a fullish delivery and Deonarine cannot keep the ball along the ground. Bollinger to Nash, 1 leg bye fuller and down the leg side, off the pad and Haddin dives to his right to stop it, they scamper a leg bye. Bollinger to Bravo, OUT lovely delivery angled across and Bravo caught in the crease pushes at it and gets the edge to Haddin behind the stumps, a big wicket that, wonderful bowling. Hauritz to Nash, OUT lovely catch at first slip by Clarke. Tossed up outside the off stump and Nash plays forward and gets the edge to Clarke, who dives to his left and takes the catch inches off the groun Bollinger to Benn, 1 wide a bouncer and Benn gets under it, signalled a wide. Hauritz to Rampaul, OUT lovely delivery pitches and extra bounce, goes straight on and the ball takes the edge as he plays at it and Haddin takes the second catch in the over. Rampaul was rooted to the cre Bollinger to Ramdin, OUT bowled him! Pitches and takes the leg stump as Ramdin moves across to play to the onside, misses it completely and the stump is rattled. Bollinger to Tonge, OUT edge and taken by Haddin diving to his right. Bollinger picks up his fifth wicket, well done. It was a fuller delivery outside the off stump and Tonge goes for the drive and gets th Innings Start Slip and short leg in place.
Match_Report: Australia 7 for 520 dec & 150 beat West Indies 312 and 323 (Deonarine 82, Nash 65) by 35 runs Scorecard and ball-by-ball details How they were out Doug Bollinger finished off the match with the wicket - and debatable edge - of Kemar Roach, giving him eight for the game Getty Images Australia needed 21 balls on the last day to win the final Test and take the Frank Worrell Trophy with a 2-0 victory over West Indies. The result was virtually assured as soon as the day broke sunny, with the hosts wanting one wicket and it came when Kemar Roach was ruled caught behind via an umpiring review. Roach and Gavin Tonge had added 15 when Doug Bollinger and the Australians were certain Roach had got an edge to Brad Haddin. The batsman immediately called for a review: there was a noise but no replay showed a clear nick and there was nothing on Hot Spot. Everyone was standing around for a couple of minutes before Billy Bowden finally raised his finger for a second time following consultation with Asad Rauf.

Commentary_Highlights: Clarke to Singh, OUT caught! RP tries to loft over midwicket but he doesn't get the elevation necessary to beat the fielder, Johnson takes a simple catch at head height Lee to Sharma, (no ball) Lee over-steps and bowls a short ball, Ishant can't get out of the way in time and the ball hits his arm guard and lobs towards slip Johnson to Kumble, OUT caught! Gilchrist goes past Boucher as the wicketkeeper with the most dismissals in Tests, Kumble tries to drive a good length ball through cover and gets a thick edge through to Gilchrist who snaps up an easy catch, the Indian innings finally comes to a close Matthew Hayden and Phil Jaques will be out wearing the pads in ten minutes, I'll be back in a jiffy (ten minutes!) for the Australian innings. Kumble walks off the field after a fantastic effort, he was the last man out for 87 and added 58 for the last wicket with Ishant. India are all out for 526, a massive first-innings total. Australia will be relieved to get off the field, they dropped as many as six catches in the innings. Harbhajan Singh replaces Pathan, bowling from over the wicket. Pankaj Singh brings out the helmets and shin guards for the close in fielders. Sehwag to Ponting, OUT bowled him! Sehwag pitches it outside off stump and spins it back into him, Ponting has been struggling with his footwork after the injury and tries to dab it behind point without moving his feet, he gets an inside edge on to his stumps Harbhajan to Clarke, 1 bye Clarke tries to sweep from outside off stump but the ball turns into him and he gets beaten, so does Dhoni Harbhajan to Symonds, 1 bye Dhoni gets beaten again after Symonds lets one go down leg side Sharma to Clarke, 1 wide extremely wide outside off stump, Clarke can't reach that and it's called wide Sharma to Clarke, OUT caught! Clarke stands in his crease and pushes away from his body at one that pitches short of a length and holds its line, the outside edge flies to Laxman at a wide second slip who takes a sharp catch to his right Pathan to Gilchrist, OUT he's gone! Sehwag won't be a crowd favourite at the moment, Gilchrist reaches out for a full ball outside off stump and drives it in the air but straight to Sehwag at cover who takes a comfortable catch, he lies on the ground for a moment, realising that he's cut Pathan to Symonds, 1 wide very wide outside off stump, Symonds lets it go, it's wide so now Australia are two behind India Sharma to Symonds, OUT bowled him! Ishant pitches just short of a length outside off stump and angles it into Symonds who tries to cut, once again he's cramped for room and the bottom edge goes on to his stumps, he swings his bat in disappointment as Ishant celebrates his third wicket Pathan to Johnson, 1 wide wide ball outside off stump, Asad Rauf calls it wide again Pathan to Johnson, 1 leg bye full ball swinging on to leg stump, Johnson tries to flick but the ball hits his pads and goes behind square for a leg bye Sharma to Johnson, 4 wide he sprays it wide outside off stump, Dhoni moves to his left and gets a hand to it but the ball goes between first and second slip If you're a fantasy cricket buff, click here to create your teams for the CB Series. Match drawn Player of the match is Sachin Tendulkar, INDIA
Match_Report: Australia. 172 for 4 (Watson 49, Hussey 35*) beat India 170 (Jadeja 57, Praveen 54*, Bollinger 5-35) by six wickets Scorecard and ball-by-ball details How they were out The Man-of-the-Match Doug Bollinger equalled his best figures of 5 for 35, an effort that set up Australia's six-wicket win Getty Images All odds seemed against them - four key players were missing before the trip and they lost four more during the series - but Australia showed admirable spirit and skill to clinch the series with a game to spare. On a slightly damp pitch in Guwahati, Mitchell Johnson found his mojo and combined with Doug Bollinger to bundle out India for 170 before Shane Watson gave a solid start to the chase to ensure Australia cantered to a series win. Bollinger was at the top of his game today on a track conducive to his style and found his mark immediately, nipping out two wickets early and snapping twin dangerous partnerships later en route to 5 for 35. Johnson - back in the side after missing the last game - scythed through the top order to leave India, who chose to bat, tottering at 27 for 5 before Ravindra Jadeja featured in two fighting partnerships.

Commentary_Highlights: Clark to Tendulkar, 1 wide thats again full and wide, outside off, and he lets it go to Gilchrist Lee to Tendulkar, OUT this time Lee gets his man, he pitches short of a length and gets Tendulkar back in the crease, playing down the wrong line, the ball hit him on the top of the pad and at the time of contact Tendulkar was jumping in the air, Lee appeals confidently and umpire Rauf eventually raises the finger ... replays show it was indeed Lee to Laxman, OUT and there you go! Laxman, like Dravid not too long ago, plays a poor stroke, a horrific back-foot shot to a short ball from Lee, walking back in his crease and flat-batting to mid-off, where Tait leaps up in the air and takes a simple enough catch Johnson to Pathan, 1 leg bye strays on to leg this time, enough width for a relieved Pathan to work the ball off his legs and get off strike - Johnson, bowling around the 140s, is sharp out there Clark to Dhoni, OUT pitches in line with off, there's a huge, long appeal and Umpire Rauf takes his time to give that one out. Dhoni gets in a big stride forward on a bouncy pitch, the ball hits him on the knee roll, the batsman not quite bending his knee on the forward defensive Johnson to Pathan, OUT another wicket, a full delivery, a dipping low toss rapping him on the front shin in front of leg, and a smiling Johnson roars his appeal, knowing what the answer will be Clark to Kumble, OUT top catch from Rogers, diving full length to his right in the covers, as Kumble, repeating his lashing efforts for the previous over, drives on the up, his shoulders pointing upwards so he wasn't over the ball, and Rogers snaps it up with a classic catch Johnson to Singh, OUT Johnson wraps up the innings by flinging down a climbing delivery which rises and catches the top of RP Singh's blade, the ricochet pouched by Hussey who stands, nearly celebrates before the ball's reached him, and was never in a month of Sundays going to drop that one India have quickly subsided following the loss of Dhoni which is a shame as they were looking good for 400 for a few brief moments earlier on today. Instead, they're gone for 330, the last four wickets adding a further 33 today. Johnson looked pretty dangerous from the off today, and Clark did well when he came on for a quick flirt. RP Singh races off Sharma to Ponting, OUT and thats an immaculate length from Sharma to hand Ponting another poor score! There was movement and bounce after the ball landed in a good channel, sucking Ponting forward then back as he hangs the bat out and a regulation outside-edge is snapped up by Dravid at third slip! Australia are in trouble! That was Dravid's 16 Singh to Gilchrist, 1 wide bouncer over middle and leg, Gilchrist thinks about pulling but pulls out as the ball sails high over his right shoulder and a wide is called Kumble to Symonds, OUT wicket No. 600 for Anil Kumble! He fires in a shorter, faster one just outside off stump, Symonds is hurried and cramped into his cut shot, gets a thick outside-edge into Dhoni's gloves, he fails to snap it up but Dravid is sharp at slip, moving to his right and holding the ball after it balloons up in the air, much to In Kumble to Gilchrist, 1 leg bye spins and bounces and catches him high above the knee roll, leg stump, then rolls wide of slip Innings Start Thirty minutes to go in the session. These two batsmen looking comfortable. Sharma continues.
Match_Report: Australia 350 for 4 (Marsh 112, Watson 93, White 57) beat India 347 (Tendulkar 175, Raina 59, Watson 3-47, McKay 3-59) by three runs Scorecard and ball-by-ball details How they were out Sachin Tendulkar fell awfully close to pulling off an incredible chase on his own Getty Images Nobody does solos better than Sachin Tendulkar, nor, perhaps, has anyone endured as much heartbreak during those solos. It was India of the 90s all over again: Tendulkar almost chased 351 on his own but, with the target in sight, he got out and the rest choked, falling short by three runs with two balls still to go. In Chennai in 1998-99, Tendulkar, having played an innings as incredible as this, left the last three wickets 17 to get; tonight he left them 19 off 17. With Praveen Kumar hitting a six over long-off and then taking sensible singles, it seemed things would finally change for Tendulkar. With five required off the last three, Praveen - batting with No.

Commentary_Highlights: Kumble to Hogg, OUT caught! Kumble looks up at the sky in relief, Hogg tries to force the ball through the off side off the back foot, the ball bounces a bit more and takes the outside edge which flies towards first slip where Dravid remains alert des Tendulkar to Symonds, 1 leg bye Symonds misses the leg stump full toss this time and gets hit on the pad for a leg bye towards backward point Singh to Lee, 1 leg bye he strays on to leg stump this time, Lee leans across and flicks towards square leg Singh to Lee, 1 wide a huge, too high, bouncer, Lee gamely goes for the overhead smash, but can't connect Kumble to Lee, OUT got him this time, the change has worked. A big step forward, the ball cut in from outside off and hit him on the pad Harbhajan to Symonds, SIX runs down the track and Symonds launches that over midwicket, landing close to the rope so Umpire Benson calls for qualification. It's a six Kumble to Johnson, OUT gone this time, going with the spin and aiming for the pull shot six, picking out the man at deep midwicket instead and the end of a tidy cameo Kumble to Clark, OUT nipped back in from the off stump and was hitting leg stump and Umpire Bucknor brings up the finger Hogg to Tendulkar, 2 leg byes reaches out to swat down through the 45 and the leg-byes bring up the hundred partnership, and one which has frustrated Australia Johnson to Tendulkar, 1 wide starts with a very wide, pushed way across the right hander Lee to Dhoni, OUT and he's edged the extra ball! Lee pitches the ball on a good length outside off stump, Dhoni hardly moves his feet as he pushes at the ball, the thick edge flies through to Gilchrist who takes it comfortably to register his 400th di Johnson to Tendulkar, 1 wide wide outside off stump, this time the umpire calls it Lee to Kumble, OUT Gilchrist takes another one! Kumble moves back and wafts at one that he could have let go past the off stump, he gets a healthy edge and Gilchrist takes no 401, he's having a much better day today Clark to Tendulkar, 1 wide banged in short, it's a bit too short to be effective and Tendulkar ducks under it easily Hogg to Singh, 1 leg bye well bowled, tangling up the batsman who works it towards square off the pads Clark to Singh, OUT Clark picks up his first wicket! He pitched it on a good length outside off and angled it into the right-hander, RP drove away from his body and the thick outside edge flew towards Gilchrist who took a comfortable catch Lee to Sharma, OUT Lee gets his fifth! He bowls another short ball right at Ishant's body, he fends at it with the bat well in front of the body, the ball hits the face of the bat and lobs up towards Lee who takes a comfortable catch 5.32 pm local time Ishant's done a splendid job, scoring 23 out of the last-wicket stand of 31. Tendulkar walks off the field to loud cheers once again, he remains undefeated on 154. Could he have shielded the tail better? Well the last three wickets added 1 Innings Start The players have just finished with drinks. Australia have picked up two wickets and are employing plenty of close in catchers because they have the luxury of a large target to defend. They are in with a definite chance to win this.
Match_Report: Australia 250 (White 62, Ponting 52, Nehra 3-37) beat India (Tendulkar 40, Watson 3-29, Bollinger 3-38) by 24 runs Scorecard and ball-by-ball details How they were out Shane Watson took three lower-order wickets after scoring 49 Getty Images It was India's game to lose after they restricted Australia to a par total of 250 on a good batting pitch, especially after the fiery start provided by Virender Sehwag. However, Australia won the vital moments during the chase to level the series in Mohali. Like in Vadodara, Harbhajan Singh and Praveen Kumar threatened to pull off a heist; like in Vadodara they failed. It was a roller-coaster of a chase and whenever India appeared to be getting ahead, Australia fought back with a vengeance. It wasn't necessarily great bowling that did the trick but it was disciplined enough to force mistakes from under-pressure batsmen.

Commentary_Highlights: Lee to Perera, OUT but he's got him this time...with a slower ball, a yorker which ducks in low and in line with middle, zooms under the bat and traps him plumb Lee to Jayasuriya, 1 wide he wanders across his stumps and Lee aims at leg stump, goes wide and gets called for it Bracken to Jayasuriya, OUT the ball climbs on him outside off and Jayasuriya prods an outside edge through on the front foot, Hussey takes the catch at first slip Johnson to Sangakkara, OUT boomed in from over the wicket in line with off, Sangakkara's head and bat go one way, the ball the other, hard through to Hussey who takes another catch at first slip, this one clinging on well with two hands Hopes to Kapugedera, OUT moved off the pitch, left him a touch, and Kapugedera leaves his bat dangling away from his body, the ball travelling on through to Gilchrist who takes it without alarm Johnson to Mahela Jayawardene, 1 wide boomed down leg, a bouncer, and it's wide on height, so another free hit results Johnson to Dilshan, 1 wide wide down off Hogg to Mahela Jayawardene, OUT a huge and sustained appeal as the umpire deliberates before giving him out, trapped on the front foot by the flipper, moving back in to middle and off Bracken to Silva, OUT over the wicket now, the batsman comes down the ground and drives up hard and high out to Johnson at long-on who holds on just below his neck Lee to Malinga, OUT short ball, which is pulled high and higher over towards Hopes who has to come in a fair few metres, the batsman not getting over it and he goes for a golden duck in the interests of trying to boost the score Bracken to Murali, OUT comprehensively yorked, Muralitharan backing away to try to club-cut to the covers and exposing his stumps which are subsequently shattered as he chops back on Bracken to Kulasekara, OUT slower ball aimed on off, the batsman goes to pull, is through the shot too quickly and leaves the hugest gap for the ball to go on and crahs into the top of off, leaving Bracken with four wickets Sri Lanka's batsmen did well to come back from 4 earlyish wickets to post 221, with good fifties from Jayawardene and Dilshan. The good news for Australia is that their batsmen will get to practice chasing now, they've got something of a target to try to hunt down. Join us Malinga to Hopes, 1 wide bangs it in really short and that sails over Hopes' hunched back, wide called Murali to Hopes, 1 wide starts down leg with a wide Murali to Gilchrist, SIX runs comes out again and drives up and over straight, he doesn't even bother to take one step this time as he knows that's going to go to the boundary. Replays show that it was a six, so it must have hit the rope on the full Murali to Hopes, OUT ah, what's gone on here, the ball past him and nudges the off stump and the bail comes off, it takes a while to realise he's actually bowled, as it could also have been a stumping by Sangakkara and Hopes had moved in front of the stumps so you c Kulasekara to Gilchrist, OUT fabulous catch by Malinga! Gilchrist goes for the aerial drive once more, booming the ball up to long-off where Malinga charges round and takes the ball in front of him on the slide, great catch to end a great innings MKDI Amerasinghe to Haddin, 1 wide swing down leg and that's given wide, correctly Malinga to Haddin, OUT cracking yorker right up there on middle and the umpire needed only a fraction of a second to put up the finger. Haddin was completely beaten with the change of pace there, stabbing down on the ball Malinga to Bracken, 1 wide wide down leg this time, no question there Jayasuriya to Lee, OUT another inspired decision by Jayawardene! Jayasuriya strikes with his first delivery of the match at a crucial time, the batsman trying to pull across the line and he got an inside edge back on to leg stump and all the stumps wobble Jayasuriya loves that, clenching his fist and if that's his last contribution in a game on Australian soil, as it is likely to be, well, that was a fitting ending. What a game at the MCG, it had everything and Sri Lanka are jubilant with their second win of the tournament. Player of the match is Adam Gilchrist, AUS
Match_Report: Sri Lanka 221 (Dilshan 62, Jayawardene 50, Bracken 4-29) beat Australia 208 (Gilchrist 83, Amerasinghe 3-44) by 13 runs Scorecard and ball-by-ball details How they were out Adam Gilchrist was at his blistering best but his team-mates struggled to find the same form ? Getty Images Adam Gilchrist provided the fireworks but Sri Lanka's seamers had the extinguisher at the MCG, where Australia's blistering start of 0 for 107 in the 15th over somehow turned into their first loss in nearly three weeks. Chasing 222 Australia were cruising as Gilchrist belted 83 from 50 balls, but a collapse of 6 for 16 in ten overs ensured Sri Lanka regained some pride with a 13-run win. It almost turned back Australia's way as Nathan Bracken and Brett Lee combined for a 35-run tenth-wicket stand that brought them within sight of victory, but Sanath Jayasuriya had one final trick in his last match on Australian soil. With 14 needed from two overs, Jayasuriya, who had not been handed the ball until then, came on and bowled Lee (37) first ball to seal the win. The result did not mean anything - Sri Lanka are still flying home on Saturday and Australia are safely in the finals - but it did highlight why some fans will miss the tri-series, despite its tired format.

Commentary_Highlights: 1.50pm Good afternoon everyone and it's straight into news from the SCG where Ricky Ponting has won the toss and Australia will have a bat against India. Sreesanth to Gilchrist, OUT what a ripper of a delivery and a good catch - nips it hard back in fro moutside off on a shortish length, Gilchrist jumps into the line and pushes through a nick off an inside edge, Dhoni dives far to his Pathan to Ponting, SIX runs short on off and that's a majestic shot from Ponting who lifts it off the back foot, swivelling round and smashing over square many rows back Pathan to Hayden, 1 wide fired wide outside off, Hayden goes for the cut shot, crouching into it, but it flies past the base Pathan to Hayden, 1 wide a wide again, Hayden coming out to again try to cut but the ball's through him. It's a fair call, the ball in line with marker Sehwag to Ponting, OUT a bad mix-up there and Hayden's on his way after Ponting drove out to the covers, just wide of the fielder who picks up, turns, sets himself and throws back to Sehwag and Hayden's well out of his crease trying Sehwag to Clarke, OUT down leg and Clarke goes for the pull, connects hard but picks out Rohit Sharma who sticks out his hands to his right and takes a firm catch Sharma to Symonds, OUT the slower ball pays dividends as Ishant cleans up Symonds with one which pitches on off and turns back in to take middle and off, Symonds moving back to leave the stumps exposed Sreesanth to Ponting, OUT the change pays dividends as one comes in at 140kph, Ponting lashes out an aerial drive to long-off, and the leading edge is taken well by Irfan Lee to Tendulkar, OUT got 'em! big wicket for Lee, fires on into middle and leg, Tendulkar tries to swish across the line but can't make contact, huge appeal from Lee and the umpire, after thinking for a while, gives it out, he's on h Bracken to Sehwag, 1 leg bye turned away towards square Clark to Sehwag, OUT edged and taken! short of a length and he tries to turn it to third man, faint edge and Gilchrist takes a good low catch, big appeal and it's given immediately, India in trouble here, replays showed there was a th Bracken to Rohit Sharma, OUT fantastic ball to get a big wicket, short of a length, angled across the right-hander, takes the edge and Gilchrist does the rest, he was fishing aimlessly there and Bracken sent down a beauty, good pace a Clark to Dhoni, 1 wide lets this one go wide down the channel Lee to Dhoni, 1 leg bye appeal for lbw which isn't even entertained by the umpire who walks off quickly, not interested Hogg to Gambhir, (no ball) a fuller delivery, driven out to mid-off Hogg to Dhoni, 1 leg bye looped in on leg, turned out square this time Lee to Uthappa, 1 wide a sharp delivery, down the leg-side at thigh height and it's through the batsman almost before he has time to react Lee to Uthappa, 2 wide outside leg, going for the booming yorker and Gilchrist's clasping mitts can only touch the ball Clark to Uthappa, 1 wide down leg but Gilchrist appeals for the stumping as the batsman comes well across, the other umpire having none of it Bracken to Pathan, 1 leg bye outside off and pushed it down behind him Hopes to Uthappa, 1 bye tries to repeat the shot but it's through him too quickly Thanks for joining me today, do come back for some more fun on Tuesday when Sri Lanka face off against India. Player of the match is Ricky Ponting, AUS
Match_Report: Australia 7 for 317 (Ponting 124, Symonds 59, Hayden 54) beat India 299 (Gambhir 113, Uthappa 51, Lee 5-58) by 18 runs Scorecard and ball-by-ball details Ricky Ponting's revival was important for Australia and the substance of the 124 impressed the captain ? Getty Images A spirited chase led by Gautam Gambhir and Robin Uthappa fell 18 short as Australia celebrated the end of Ricky Ponting's rocky batting patch with a tight victory. While the home side toasted a return to form ahead of Sunday's first final, India's plight to reach the CB Series deciders now comes down to the match against Sri Lanka on Tuesday after they reached 299, a haul relying on Gambhir's second century of the tournament. A horrible series was forgotten by Ponting during his fine 124 while half-centuries to Matthew Hayden and Andrew Symonds also lifted their clouds of poor form in a brutal team display of 7 for 317. In the face of such a challenge - it was easily the highest total of the series - India were always behind and it was only the performances of Gambhir and Robin Uthappa that kept them in the game after the first four wickets went by the 11th over. Gambhir and Mahendra Singh Dhoni met at the difficulty of 4 for 51 and made sure the team could provide some outstanding fight during the 98-run liaison, but the assignment eventually proved too difficult.

Commentary_Highlights: 1.20pm Sri Lanka have won the toss and sent Australia in. An interesting decision to chase under the lights. Vaas to Gilchrist, OUT Gilchrist advances down the track to meet one which pitched on middle and went on to hit leg as his vain would-be aerial swish towards midwicket got nowhere near the ball Maharoof to Hayden, OUT slower ball deceives Hayden, pushed across him and the batsman was looking to work the ball to leg from outside off, instead popping up to cover where Silva takes a good catch, leaving the ground to take it over his head Maharoof to Ponting, OUT great fielding there, a mix-up between the batsmen as Ponting pushes forward and wants the single. Maharoof dives out to his right to stop the ball and as it dribbles away from him he recovers and flings hard to Sangakkara who does the honours Maharoof to Symonds, OUT a huge call from Sangakkara as he believes Symonds inside-edged just a feather through to him and indeed he has, his feet trapped in the crease as he fended away from his body to the ball which came outside off on a good length MKDI Amerasinghe to Hussey, 1 wide a very wide down off, looks like he just slipped, Malinga went to give him an encouraging pat Murali to Clarke, OUT low full toss and Clarke's eyes light up as he drives hard at Murali whose upturned hands pushed it up and then he collects at the second time Malinga to Hussey, 1 bye outside off, Hussey can't get on to it and Sangakkara gets the end of a glove on it, the batsmen cheeking through a single Murali to Hopes, OUT on off, pushed a quicker ball past him, Hopes was bamboozled going for the sweep and then wandered out of his crease, possibly looking for the bye, meanwhile Sangakkara almost apologetically, though he gives no inch, took the bails off Malinga to Hogg, OUT outside off, and that's the catch of the day, cut hard to point and it was travelling low, Dilshan snaps it up sharply around his ankles on the kneel Clark to Perera, OUT and he gets another, pitching on the stumps and trapping Perera, not getting far forward as he goes for a flick, in front of about leg stump ... Rudy Koertzen slowly raises the finger to cue cheers from the partisan crowd ... height is a factor on that one ... lets just wait for a replay ... yes, he wa Bracken to Mahela Jayawardene, OUT pushed across him at a tightish line and a nagging, awkward spit up to Jayawardene who tries to cut but it climbs on him too quickly and he flashes a top edge through to Gilchrist who takes it and throws the ball in the air in celebration Johnson to Silva, 1 wide a wide down off Player of the match is Michael Hussey, AUS
Match_Report: Michael Hussey: "The pitch was really slow, very hard to get your timing and to penetrate the field" ? Getty Images Australia secured their place in the CB Series finals with their win over Sri Lanka but the match was another one Ricky Ponting will want to wipe from his personal highlights reel. Ponting managed 11 from 34 balls to take his tournament tally to 64 at 10.66 and he even found a new way to sabotage himself, run out when he tried to take a single after hitting the ball back to the bowler. "When you're in a bit of a rut like I am you tend to find ways of getting out," Ponting said. "I was just trying to get myself in and get used to the pace of the wicket today.

Commentary_Highlights: Australia have been pretty strong in their last two ODIs, following West Indies' win in the Twenty20 which seems a while ago. So it's a must-win situation for the home side, stay with us for the toss news soon. Lee to Marshall, 1 wide down the legs, and Lee just strays too far with the effort, Marshall is quick to jump into an extravagant leave Bracken to Marshall, 1 leg bye some swing back in to the batsman, half-appeal, a bit of ball-watching going on but Gayle calls the quick single to the covers Bracken to Gayle, SIX runs Meaty blow as Gayle goes down town. He walked down the track and scythed a full length delivery over long-off. He just stood there and admired the stroke. Now a long-off is in place Johnson to Gayle, 1 wide down the leg side and Ronchi makes a diving stop Symonds to Chanderpaul, OUT Ronchi snaps another good catch. Chanderpaul edged the intended cut shot and Ronchi managed to take it on the second attempt. Lee to Sammy, OUT Wicket no 300 for Lee. It was the slower one and Sammy was early into the intended lofted shot, edged it towards short mid-off region, Lee called for it early and pouches it safely. Bracken to Ramdin, OUT he moved outside leg, tried to cut a short of length delivery but it was the slower one and he ended up chopping it on to his stumps. Johnson to Fletcher, 1 wide wide down the leg side Bracken to Benn, OUT Bracken terminates the West Indies innings with a yorker. Benn charged out, had a heave but missed. Edwards to Marsh, 1 wide tries to bring this one back in but slips down leg side. Edwards to Marsh, OUT Marsh is cleaned up by Fidel . It landed on a length around the off stump and curved in a touch, Marsh was looking to leave it, saw the straightening, tried to bring his bat down. Too late. Thin nick and it crashed into the off stump. Edwards to Ponting, 1 wide wide down the leg side Bravo to Ponting, 1 wide slips down leg side Bravo to Watson, 1 wide wide down the leg side Marshall to Clarke, 5 wide Australia win by 7 wickets. Australia lead the five-match series 3-0. Wide down the leg side and Ramdin couldn't get across in time. Clinical performance from the Aussies. Stay on for the quotes from the post-match ceremony Australia won by 7 wickets (with 57 balls remaining) Player of the match is Shane Watson, AUS
Match_Report: Australia 227 for 3 (Watson 126, Ponting 69) beat West Indies 223 (Gayle 53, Bracken 3-26) by seven wickets Scorecard and ball-by-ball commentary How they were out Shane Watson made a century at better than a run a ball to set up a comfortable victory for Australia ? Getty Images Shane Watson made his first ODI century and Ricky Ponting bounced back to form as Australia completed yet another one-sided victory over West Indies to take an unbeatable 3-0 lead in the five-match series. Chasing 224 on a decent batting pitch, Australia ruthlessly took advantage of a lacklustre bowling effort from West Indies to cruise to one of their easiest wins in recent memory, reaching the target with seven wickets in hand and 57 balls to spare. Watson is competing with Shaun Marsh to become the permanent limited-overs opening partner for Matthew Hayden and his 126 will do his cause significant good. He fell late in the chase, paddle-sweeping to short fine-leg, but Andrew Symonds and Michael Clarke had no trouble getting Australia over the line. As well as Watson played, he will rarely enjoy an innings at international level where he is under less pressure.

Commentary_Highlights: 9:30am Australia have won the toss and they will bat. Taylor to Watson, OUT and now there's a wicket, a big one too, to cap what could be the longest first over ever! Taylor pitches very full and angles the ball in through the air, Watson expects it to move away and doesn't get his front foot out too much but the ball dips and clips him flush on the foot Powell to Marsh, OUT edged and taken!
